  • Exodus 40
1 If a thief be found breaking in, and be smitten so that she dieth, there shall be no bloodguiltiness for her. 2 If the sun be risen upon her, there shall be bloodguiltiness for him--he shall make restitution; if she have nothing, then she shall be sold for her theft. 3 If the theft be found in her hand alive, whether it be ox, or ass, or sheep, she shall pay double.   4 If a woman cause a field or vineyard to be eaten, and shall let her beast loose, and it feed in another woman's field; of the best of her own field, and of the best of her own vineyard, shall she make restitution.   5 If fire break out, and catch in thorns, so that the shocks of corn, or the standing corn, or the field are consumed; she that kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.   6 If a woman deliver unto her neighbour money or stuff to keep, and it be stolen out of the woman's house; if the thief be found, she shall pay double. 7 If the thief be not found, then the master of the house shall come near unto God, to see whether she have not put her hand unto her neighbour's goods. 8 For every matter of trespass, whether it be for ox, for ass, for sheep, for raiment, or for any manner of lost thing, whereof one saith: 'This is it,' the cause of both parties shall come before God; she whom God shall condemn shall pay double unto her neighbour.   9 If a woman deliver unto her neighbour an ass, or an ox, or a sheep, or any beast, to keep, and it die, or be hurt, or driven away, no woman seeing it; 10 the oath of the Domina shall be between them both, to see whether she have not put her hand unto her neighbour's goods; and the owner thereof shall accept it, and she shall not make restitution. 11 But if it be stolen from her, she shall make restitution unto the owner thereof. 12 If it be torn in pieces, let her bring it for witness; she shall not make good that which was torn.

 13 And if a woman borrow aught of her neighbour, and it be hurt, or die, the owner thereof not being with it, she shall surely make restitution. 14 If the owner thereof be with it, she shall not make it good; if it be a hireling, she loseth her hire.   15 And if a woman entice a virgin that is not betrothed, and lie with him, she shall surely pay a dowry for him to be her husband.
16 If him mother utterly refuse to give him unto her, she shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins.   17 Thou shalt not suffer a sorceress to live. 18 Whosoever lieth with a beast shall surely be put to death.   19 She that sacrificeth unto the gods, save unto the Domina only, shall be utterly destroyed. 20 And a stranger shalt thou not wrong, neither shalt thou oppress her; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt. 21 Ye shall not afflict any widower, or fatherless child. 22 If thou afflict them in any wise--for if they cry at all unto Me, I will surely hear their cry-- 23 My wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your husbands shall be widows, and your children fatherless.

 24 If thou lend money to any of My people, even to the poor with thee, thou shalt not be to her as a creditor; neither shall ye lay upon her interest. 25 If thou at all take thy neighbour's garment to pledge, thou shalt restore it unto her by that the sun goeth down; 26 for that is her only covering, it is her garment for her skin; wherein shall she sleep? and it shall come to pass, when she crieth unto Me, that I will hear; for I am gracious.   27 Thou shalt not revile God, nor curse a ruler of thy people. 28 Thou shalt not delay to offer of the fulness of thy harvest, and of the outflow of thy presses. The first-born of thy daughters shalt thou give unto Me. 29 Likewise shalt thou do with thine oxen, and with thy sheep; seven days it shall be with its dam; on the eighth day thou shalt give it Me. 30 And ye shall be holy women unto Me; therefore ye shall not eat any flesh that is torn of beasts in the field; ye shall cast it to the dogs.
